title: Returning
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                             |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A skilled user can throw it in such a way that it will return to its owner. |

Weapons with the **returning** property will return to the user's [inventory](/Inventory "Inventory") when thrown unless they [mulch](/Mulch "Mulch").

[Boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang") innately possess the returning property, and may have an additional brand.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), the [Dungeon Sprint](/Dungeon_Sprint "Dungeon Sprint") exclusive [unique](/Unique "Unique"), [Chuck](/Chuck "Chuck"), had a [large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock") of returning.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), returning was a brand that could be found on [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") and [tomahawks](/Tomahawk "Tomahawk"), and Throwing skill determined the chance the weapon would return to the thrower. Tomahawks were replaced by [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang"), which always return.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), returning [large rocks](/Large_rock "Large rock"), [stones](/Stone "Stone"), [arrows](/Arrow "Arrow"), [bolts](/Bolt "Bolt"), and [sling bullets](/Sling_bullet "Sling bullet") could be found in a rare ammunition shop.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), this brand could also appear on the throwable melee weapons: [daggers](/Dagger "Dagger"), [clubs](/Club "Club"), [hand axes](/Hand_axe "Hand axe"), and [spears](/Spear "Spear").

| [Brands](/Brand "Brand") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Melee weapons            | [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") • [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") • [Distortion](/Distortion "Distortion") • [Draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)") • [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") • [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") • [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") • [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy") • [Holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") • [Pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)") • [Protection](/Protection "Protection") • [Reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") • [Spectral](/Spectral_\(brand\) "Spectral (brand)") • [Speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)") • [Vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") • [Venom](/Venom "Venom") [Disruption](/Disruption "Disruption") • [Dragon slaying](/Dragon_slaying "Dragon slaying") • [Reaping](/Reaping "Reaping") • [Silver](/Silver "Silver") |
| Launchers                | [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") • [Draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)") • [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") • [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") • [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") • [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy") • [Penetration](/Penetration "Penetration") • [Speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Throwing weapons         | [Atropa](/Atropa "Atropa") • [Curare](/Curare "Curare") • [Datura](/Datura "Datura") • [Dispersal](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)") • [Poisoned](/Poisoned "Poisoned") • [Silver](/Silver "Silver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
html:
Returning

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
A skilled user can throw it in such a way that it will return to its owner.

Weapons with the returning property will return to the user's inventory when thrown unless they mulch.

Boomerangs innately possess the returning property, and may have an additional brand.

History

  • Prior to 0.27, the Dungeon Sprint exclusive unique, Chuck, had a large rock of returning.
  • Prior to 0.24, returning was a brand that could be found on javelins and tomahawks, and Throwing skill determined the chance the weapon would return to the thrower. Tomahawks were replaced by boomerangs, which always return.
  • Prior to 0.15, returning large rocks, stones, arrows, bolts, and sling bullets could be found in a rare ammunition shop.
  • Prior to 0.14, this brand could also appear on the throwable melee weapons: daggers, clubs, hand axes, and spears.
Brands
Melee weapons Antimagic • Chaos • Distortion • Draining • Electrocution • Flaming • Freezing • Heavy • Holy wrath • Pain • Protection • Reaching • Spectral • Speed • Vampiric • Venom
Disruption • Dragon slaying • Reaping • Silver
Launchers Antimagic • Draining • Electrocution • Flaming • Freezing • Heavy • Penetration • Speed
Throwing weapons Atropa • Curare • Datura • Dispersal • Poisoned • Silver

{{version028}}
{{flavour|A skilled user can throw it in such a way that it will return to its owner.}}

Weapons with the '''returning''' property will return to the user's [[inventory]] when thrown unless they [[mulch]].

[[Boomerang]]s innately possess the returning property, and may have an additional brand.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.27]], the [[Dungeon Sprint]] exclusive [[unique]], [[Chuck]], had a [[large rock]] of returning.
*Prior to [[0.24]], returning was a brand that could be found on [[javelin]]s and [[tomahawk]]s, and Throwing skill determined the chance the weapon would return to the thrower. Tomahawks were replaced by [[boomerang]]s, which always return.
*Prior to [[0.15]], returning [[large rock]]s, [[stone]]s, [[arrow]]s, [[bolt]]s, and [[sling bullet]]s could be found in a rare ammunition shop.
*Prior to [[0.14]], this brand could also appear on the throwable melee weapons: [[dagger]]s, [[club]]s, [[hand axe]]s, and [[spear]]s.
